oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Janāb-i Ba-davlatnī hikāyātlārī : manuscript, 1904 or 5
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Andījānī, Aḥmad Qulī.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Widener Library, Harvard University
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An eyewitness account of Yaqub Beg's rule in parts of Xinjiang.
Written in one column, 16 lines per page, in black. Text framed within double black lines and each line also framed within double black lines.
According to the colophon (f. 28v), copy completed in 1322 AH [1904 or 5 AD] in Kashgar.
MS Turk 71. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Yaʻqub Beg--Khan of Kashghar--1820?-1877
Asia, Central--History
Xinjiang Uygur Zizhiqu (China)--History

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: جناب بدولت ني حكايات لاري : مخطوطة، 1904 or 5
